trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as **Design** view in [!INCLUDE[vs_current_short](~/includes/vs-current-short-md.md)]), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control markup is parsed.
A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface.
When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as the markup for the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control in a visual designer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets a list of items that are used to create an action list menu at design time.
A collection that contains the action list items.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure"></xref> method can be called by the design host.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method can be called if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
In that case, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property value is `true`.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property is `true`, the **Configure Data Source** menu item is displayed in the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface.
When this item is selected, the **Configure Data Source** wizard is started.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure"></xref> method can be called; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema(System.Boolean)"></xref> method can be called by the design host.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method can be called if all the following conditions are true:

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceView.ContextTypeName%2A> property contains a value.
If these conditions are true, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> property value is `true`.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> is `true`, the **Refresh Schema** menu item is displayed in the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema(System.Boolean)"></xref> method can be called; otherwise, `false`.
Launches the data source configuration wizard in the design host.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method starts the **Configure Data Source** wizard on the visual designer surface.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method is called when the **Configure Data Source** menu item is selected on the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control.
The **Configure Data Source** menu item appears on the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property is `true`.
Gets or sets the name of the type that contains the property whose value has the data that you want to retrieve.
The name of the class to retrieve data from.
Gets or sets a value for the delete operation.
In a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> instance, setting this property has no effect.
This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
`null`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows can be deleted from the data source at run time.
`true` if the delete operation is enabled for users of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows can be inserted into the data source at run time.
`true` if the insert operation is enabled for users of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether rows in the data source can be updated at run time.
`true` if the update operation is enabled for users of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> instance; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a data source view that has the specified name.
The name of the view to return.
An object whose name is specified by viewName; otherwise, `null`.
Gets a list of available views.
A collection with one element that contains the name "DefaultView".
Gets or sets the value that is used when the Group By clause is being created.
A string that contains the properties that are used for grouping data.
Initializes the control designer and loads the specified component.
The object to initialize.
Gets or sets a value for the delete operation.
In a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> instance, setting this property has no effect.
This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
`null`.
Gets or sets the value that is used when the Order By clause is being created.
A string that contains the properties that are used for sorting the data.
Gets or sets the value that is used when the Order Groups By clause is being created.
A string that contains the properties that are used for sorting grouped data.
Used by the designer to add properties or remove properties in the properties grid.
The properties to be filtered.
Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.

The design host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method only if <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> is `true`.
`true` to suppress all data source events until the schema is refreshed.
Gets or sets the string that contains values for the select operation.
A string that is used when the Select clause is being created.
Gets the service provider that is associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> instance.
An object that represents the service provider.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.TableName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> instance.
The name of the class that contains the data.
Gets the value for the Update operation.
In a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> instance, setting this property has no effect.
This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.
`null`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Where"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource"></xref> control.
The value of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource.Where"></xref> property.
